author: J.K. Rowling
title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the magical world and Harry's journey as a wizard.

author: George R.R. Martin
title: A Game of Thrones
description: The first book in the epic fantasy series, following the political struggles for the Iron Throne.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: The Lord of the Rings
description: A classic high fantasy novel about the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the dark lord Sauron.

author: Stephen King
title: The Shining
description: A horror novel about a family that becomes trapped in a haunted hotel with supernatural forces.

author: Agatha Christie
title: And Then There Were None
description: A mystery novel about ten strangers who are lured to an isolated island and begin to be killed one by one.

author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
title: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

author: J.D. Salinger
title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A coming-of-age story about a teenager's experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school.

author: Charles Dickens
title: A Tale of Two Cities
description: A historical novel set against the backdrop of the French Revolution, exploring themes of sacrifice and redemption.

author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A romantic novel exploring issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England.

author: Mark Twain
title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: A novel about a young boy's journey down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave, exploring themes of racism and freedom.
